intro: Axanthes tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly axanthes, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its soft, hairy foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in summer and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Axanthes tomentosa is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and drought-resistant properties.
